actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for approximately 6:30 P.M. today.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2812.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2812 — "To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to carry out a study of the costs associated with small- and medium-sized companies to undertake initial public offerings."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2793.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2793 — "To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to expand the ability to use testing the waters and confidential draft registration submissions, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 43.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Edwards moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution. H. Con. Res. 43 — "Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the Greater Washington Soap Box Derby."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2610.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2610 — "To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify certain registration statement contents for emerging growth companies, to permit issuers to file draft registration statements with the Securities and Exchange Commission for confidential review, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2608.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2608 — "To amend the Federal securities laws to specify the periods for which financial statements are required to be provided by an emerging growth company, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2593.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2593 — "To create an interdivisional taskforce at the Securities and Exchange Commission for senior investors."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1579.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 1579 — "To amend the Securities Act of 1933 and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act with respect to the definition of accredited investor, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 835.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mrs. Wagner moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 835 — "To amend the Securities Act of 1933 to codify certain qualifications of individuals as accredited investors for purposes of the securities laws."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a message from the Clerk. Pursuant to the permission granted in Clause 2(h) of Rule II of the Rules of the U.S. House of Representatives, the Clerk received the following message from the Secretary of the Senate on June 2, 2023, at 9:56 a.m.: That the Senate passed S. 769, H.R. 3746, and H.J. Res. 45.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Michelle Fischbach to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
